Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10!!!”
Reviews.Author: Weekeri03
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four day stay in Rome. Stayed in Hotel Madrid and I was most impressed. Fantastic location, literally 2 minutes from the lovely Soanish steps and 10 minutes from the Trevi Fountain. There were 5 of us travelling and the room was more than adequate, plenty of room and absolutely spotless. Roof top terrace for breakfast was delightful with a fine selection to start your day. Cannot recommend Hotel Madrid enough. It's set in a little cobbled side street, with lots of lovely restaurants nearby. Hotel arranged airpot pick up to and from the airport too which was great. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Will definitely return. Just hope the weather is better next time! Thanks for a lovely trip Hotel Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great hotel - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nick K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 4 minutes from the Spanish Steps but in a side street so active without being too touristy. 20 - 30 minutes walk takes you to either the Vatican City or the Coloseum, 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain and everything else in between. The hotel is within a few minutes walk of enough restaurants to satisfy all tastes. Our room was very clean, very comfortable and overlooked the front street, others have said it is noisy but we slept with the windows open to enjoy the sounds of Rome - The windows are triple glazed so if you want peace and quiet its obtainable - We will be using this hotel again as it was part of one of the best trips we have ever had. Breakfasts are a must and the rooftop view is a good way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kaarina2011
Reviews.Content: The room was ok , but the shower did not work properly -it changed the temperature randomly and it was either burningly hot or icecold. Wifi was not free and you needed to enter the password again every single time you used it. Breakfast room was nice and food ok, according to italian standards.

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: HungryTraveller407
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely a good find. Helpful staff, terrific location and decent breakfast with great cappucinos to start off the day. Our 2-bedroom suite was also very comfortable. Btw this street is by no means a quiet one, expect a lot of noise. It appears Italians love to sing, especially at nights :) but it all makes for a lovely atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location,welcoming and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: itay0304
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in a hotel for a marathon in Rome. Very courteous staff, clean rooms and provide excellent value for payment. Excellent hotel location near the Spanish Steps It is strongly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean tidy and awesome breakfast with views of the st peters cathedral... Thanks matias”
Reviews.Author: Matcarrio
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, clean tidy and awesome breakfast with views of the st peters cathedral... Thanks matias

Reviews.Title: “Rugby and tourist weekend”
Reviews.Author: joprideaux1
Reviews.Content: Room basic but spotless. Mattress a little hard for me. Substantial continental breakfast on the roof terrace with views of Rome set you up for the day. We visited for the rugby when there was snow for the first time in 40 yrs! even with the snow we could walk to stadium in 50 mins from the hotel, if we hadn't stopped off the light refreshment. Good family run restaurant close to hotel is no 37, all 8 us had fab meals, mains on average costing 10-20 euros. As all other reviewers have stated location was brilliant, you could walk to all the main tourist attractions easily and hopefully, unlike us find them open as there won't be snow when you visit. Will return with the children and when it's warmer!

Reviews.Title: “Very good Italian hotel with superb location!”
Reviews.Author: Kuba_10
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! It's perfectly located hotel with 200 meters from Spanish Steps and c.a. 400 meters from Fontanna Di Trevi! It's also very close to all other attractions such as Piazza Venezia, not far away from Piazza Navona, also perfect for weekend shopping on Via del Corso and nearby Via dei Condotti (prada, gucci, bvlgari, etc.) Very good and rich breakfast in hotel's ristorante located beautifully on the roof! Rooms are clean, warm and so Italian. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: imran_jaafar
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome during the 3rd week of December 2011. It was very near to the Spagna Metro station, and it is incredibly near to both the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The famous Via dei Condotti is just 2 blocks away. I was amazed with the perfect location of this hotel. The staff were very nice to us throughout our stay. The concierge was helpful in answering our questions and providing suggestions. If you have a laptop (or a smartphone with wifi), you can use the wifi-network for 5 Euros for the entire length of your stay. I enjoyed my morning interactions with the lady at the rooftop restaurant. She makes excellent cappuccino. Her coffee was so good that to the point it became something me & my fiancee look forward to every single morning! I was impressed with the size of the room and the toilet. While the bed was like any average hotel, the shower is incredibly good. Must have been a recent installment. Overall I had a very pleasant stay. I couldn't have chosen a better hotel with such an excellent location. Highly recommended to all!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: racerbone
Reviews.Content: so basically this hotel is ok, nothing great or fancy but it is in a good location. the breakfast is ok. some of the staff are a bit rude and short, others are quite polite and helpful, depends who you get. would i stay here again, probably not but it was ok. its also quite expensive for what it is which is probably why i wouldnt stay here again. the elevator is scary. not very clean and it needs to be updated, especially the rooms. also, i dont know what they did with the bed frames and/or mattresses but ours tilted up at the foot end!?! weird! resulting in some uncomfortable sleeping. small tv, 3 channels.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: LucyMP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Madrid in early October. There was an issue with my reservation but the staff handled it really well. Luciano is the name of the person who helped me. He was professional and service oriented and turned a bad experience into a good one. The ladies in the breakfast room are very nice and helpful… the location is fantastic, I was very satisfied with the service and I will definitely come back. Thanks to the staff for making my stay in Rome memorable

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: karenk819
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Madrid for 6 nights on a recent trip to Rome. It is located in a nice area, within walking distance to many piazzas, museum and churches that I wanted to visit. It is also close to transportation, including the Metro, which made it easy to get around Rome. it is a nicely appointed hotel, beautiful and comfortable. The staff was always very helpful, before and during my stay. I also enjoyed the al fresco performance of a man singing in italian on the street in the evening..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ladyhighley
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel; one pre-cruise and the other post-cruise. The hotel is centrally located near the Spanish Steps and exclusive shopping. It is also walking distance from all the great sights this magnificent city has to offer. We were traveling with our adult children and shared a two bedroom suite, which was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was very big, which in Europe is a rarity, where bathrooms tend to be small. The staff was very helpful and attentive, giving good recommendations for dinner. They also made arrangements for transportation to and from the port and to the airport and everything ran smoothly and timely. The vans were in top condition and the driver who took us to the airport made sure personally that we were in the correct terminal before dropping us off. I would recommend this hotel to everyone who is visiting Rome and will stay there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & and wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mariposa852
Reviews.Content: When I was researching for hotels in Rome prior to our trip I was overwhelmed by the amount of hotels there are in the city. It was a blessing that I stumbled on Hotel Madrid. We decided to go with it and I had no regrets. It's sort of your neighborhood boutique hotel, centrally located and with stunning views of the capital from it's roof top terrace. It does not happen everyday to get to have a delicious, fresh prepared breakfast on a roof top overlooking Rome! Apart from the location and the views, the staff is incredibly polite, welcoming and friendly. It is great for a couple's romantic getaway but also for family adventuring in the eternal city. The cleanliness of the rooms and the common areas was above my expectations, you can tell that they take great care of this place and more then anything they take great care of their customers. I will return to Hotel Madrid without hesitation on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: redderzooming
Reviews.Content: Rome is famous for the very expensive and very poor hotels; Hotel Madrid was the first thing, but not the second. Tastefully decorated, and much more renovated than I expected. Breakfast is served in a terrace in the fifth floor, and the quality is very good. It's a couple of minutes away from Piazza d'Spagna and the Fontana de Trevi. Very well communicated with buses to Trastevere, Vatican and the north with Villa Borghese. You will end up paying a lot for your hotel in Rome, so it's better to pay it for a good hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel located in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: noelm789
Reviews.Content: The centrally located hotel have excellent service and a very good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Recommend”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: We were staying on our honeymoon at a hotel down the road. When we tried to extend our holiday there, they wanted to charge us an additional $70 on top of the daily rate for the cupboard they had us staying in. I balked at this and even more when they said that it was due to the high tourist numbers during the august holiday period (ridiculous as most italians either go overseas or to the beach - not to rome). So I walked down the street and found Hotel Madrid - friendly staff, good service and a great breakfast. The best hotel breakfast in Italy I found.

Reviews.Title: “Trip advisor reviews paid off”
Reviews.Author: Annalene
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Rome before so I did lots a research when planning where to stay in Rome. After reading other good reviews on tripadvisor I booked this hotel. When we arrived my husband was mortified that I had chosen a 3 star hotel. The hotel was fantastic I don’t have a bad word to say, best of all was the location we walked everywhere. The breakfast every morning from the roof terrace was great and the staff at breakfast were fantastic especially to the children we looked forward to the cappuccino every morning before we started sightseeing for the day. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “20 years of excellence at Hotel Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Michele G
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Hotel Madrid 1 - 2 times a year for the past 20 years. The rooms are clean, bathrooms are a good size, the staff is excellent - ready and willing to help with anything you may need. Best of all is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! The hotel is a few blocks from the Spanish Steps and a 5-10 minute walk to the Trevi fountain, the main shopping area, the Pantheon, Piazza del Popolo, Piazza Navona and easy to get to all the major sites in central Rome. I would highly recommend this hotel and thank Fulvio, Luciano and the dedicated staff who are like family to me.

Reviews.Title: “They saved our visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kathy A
Reviews.Content: Due to unexpected circumstances we had to find a new hotel and it was Saturday night in Rome. We stopped in at the Hotel Madrid, where Max went out of his way to assist us. Not only did he find us a room, he made some adjustments so we could have it all 4 nights. The rooftop breakfast dining was a beautiful spot and Max made sure to tell us to go up at sunset and see the view. We would highly recommend the Hotel Madrid!!

Reviews.Title: “Good service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous C
Reviews.Content: + The location of Hotel Madrid is good when you find the hotel as it around 15 min from Metro, short distance to the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps and shopping! The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean. Good service in breadfast room eg fresh fruit and hot foods, A/C worked. - Before you go there, you make sure check the clear direction between Metro Spagna and Hotel as it quite waste time

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pompeianista
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling to Italy very frequently in the past 9 years and Hotel Madrid is my favourite hotel to stay in. My boyfriend and I have been several times and his parents came with us as well another time. Very clean hotel with quite spacious rooms and the largest bathrooms I've seen in Rome, complete with fantastic bathtub & shower. The bed is large and comfortable and the airconditioning is fantastic in the hottest weather. The windows are properly sealed for the noise outside, which is rare to find in Rome. The decoration is tasteful and in keeping with the hotel's era; all of the furniture and paintwork were in excellent shape. The breakfast is delicious on the rooftop terrace (year round, I think): a cooked breakfast is available, as well as continental style breakfasts of cereals, baked goods, meats and cheeses, and yogurts. I especially like that the staff are so friendly and at breakfast they freshly prepare a cappuccino (or any type of coffee) just as your ask. The best experience I've had at this hotel was when my wallet was stolen somewhere in the city. The hotel was wonderful helping me to contact the police, including speaking with them and directing me to the nearest police station. I really appreciated the front desk staff's kindness in helping me, in addition to their everyday cheerfulness. We now tell our friends to stay there and they have all loved it too. Can't wait to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms for large families”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaLima
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Madrid for 4 nights last July (2011) with my husband and two daughters (12 and 7). We booked a Suite and it was very comfortable, with two separate rooms and one “huge” bathroom. The kid’s beds were real beds, and NOT extra, uncomfortable ones like many other places we stayed during our vacation in Italy. Our room faced the street, but the windows were soundproof and we weren’t disturbed. There was a free breakfast buffet on the top floor. It was not “gourmet”, but there was everything we needed to start our day. The location was also great: few steps from the Spanish Steps, Via Condotti, Via Cavour and the subway station. Two small drawbacks won’t let me give 5 stars to Hotel Madrid: 1) The furniture was completely outdated and the small TV only have 5 or 6 channels. 2) The staff was friendly, but English was sometimes a barrier. I’d recommend Hotel Madrid to any friend, especially if they were travelling with kids. Around the hotel: - If you are looking for a nice family place to have pizza or pasta try Pizza Ciro (Via della Mercede 43-45), a few steps from the hotel. -If you want to shop designer stuff (Gucci, Prada, Ferragamo…) go to Via dei Condotti, but if you are looking for something affordable to take home, go to Via del Corso (from Via dei Condotti to Piazza del Popolo) and you won’t regret.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel for the Price in The Best Location in Room!”
Reviews.Author: Salvatore D
Reviews.Content: Background: I live near Philadelphia, travel a lot, I am Italian of first decent, I speak Italian very well, I travel to Italy often and I believe my expectations about traveling are realistic, though I do have high expectations about cleanliness and service. This is my second stay at Hotel Madrid. First time was in 1992. Great 3 star hotel in one of the Rome’s best neighborhoods. For under 300 Euros a night, we got a 2 room suite for 4 people and it was clean and large enough (considering how small these rooms typically are) for a family of 4. Un-heard of in Rome! Clean, great morning breakfast on the roof top terrace. Beds are hard as are almost all beds in Italy, unless you pay 500 Euros a night or more in a more American style hotel. Front staff, especially Max, are great and really want to ensure your stay is to your. Rome is like NY City. Very expensive and you get what you pay for, but here you get more than what you pay for, that is what makes it special. So if you need a clean place to sleep, with a full time front desk for a family of 4 for under 300 Euros in the city’s best neighborhood, than I highly recommend Hotel Madrid! Room 102 – NY boutique style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: vanilla11
Reviews.Content: We book the hotel because of the excellent reviews on Tripadvosor. Our stay was for a pre-cruise visit to Rome for only 2 nights. The next morning after we arrived, we were supposed get picked up by this limo company called Rome Limousine byJohn for a sightseeing tour but they did not show up at the pick up time. The front office agent Antonio, immediately help us by calling them but only to find out they were'nt coming. Antonio helped us book 2 seperate bus tours rightaway knowing that we did not have time to waste. He is tall, good looking and very professional. The service at this hotel is outstanding from the front offce to the breakfast area on the terrace to housekeeping. The lady on the terrace during breakfast time made great capaccinos and reminded us when we leave to take our cameras and belongings. We had an airconditioning problem one night and it was fixed in 2 minutes. I would recommend this hotel to everyone because of the location, service and everything else you read about. They also arraranged airport pick up and transfer to port, it was very easy. Also if you could, book on their own website and pay cash when you checkout so you get 10% off. Now I really know why they deserve all these great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “second time we've stayed, just as good”
Reviews.Author: trvl-hppy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two years ago and were very impressed with the service and room. This year we took our two children and met my parent for a few days together in Rome. We were able to get a room with a queen sized bed in one room with a smaller room attached that had two twins for the kids. The bathroom was large and newly renevated. Our shower was very large (and not a stall like most Italian hotel showers). My parents has a nice room as well with a large bathroom and shower. Can't say enough about this place. The rooftop breakfast is included and offers great choices of breads, meats, cheeses, yogurt and fruit to enjoy while viewing St Peter's Bacillica. Only downside was we had to pay 5 euro for WiFi (everywhere else in Italy we stayed it was complementary) and had lots of problems getting the signal in the room. But that's the worsed I can say.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Madrid is perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: gowithfam
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in this lovely hotel with family. We booked this hotel because of its location (near the Spanish steps) and they had a family suite that accomadated 4 (we have two boys ages 15 & 12). It absolutely met our expectations. The location couldn't have been better. We were so close to the Spanish Steps (3 minutes or so) and Trevi Fountain (5-7 Minutes) and a short walk to everywhere else ! Great dining very close! The famly suite includes a small room with two day beds for the boys attached to the bedroom. Each room had its own air conditioner (though a little noisy) and light control and access to the the bathroom (a small bathroom that could maybe accomodate 2 at the most). The hotel staff is very nice! The breakfast woman especially! She greeted us every morning and offered to make hot chocolate for the boys (who were still sleeping). The front desk were very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations! They even told me about a laundromat where I dropped off my clothes in the AM and picked it up in the PM and only had to pay 2 Euro extra for the service of having them do it!!! The breakfast room is a delightful rooftop eating area! The breakfast is served until 10 each day with your usual European Hotel spread. Perfect location and great hotel for a family! The

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Service, Delicious Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Anna4590
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location, minutes away from the Spanish Steps, one block away from Via Condotti and The Trevi Fountain. Hotel is very cozy , has spacious rooms and great friendly and professional service. The complimentary breakfast is superb, very large selection of pastries, hot breakfast foods, meats. Choice of tea, cappuccino, espresso or regular coffee. Getting to and from airport was a breeze because hotel ordered the taxi and picked us up at the airport. Our first time in Rome and we had an unforgettable experience largely thanks to this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaCarolyn
Reviews.Content: .My husband (who is Italian) and I have stayed in Hotel Madrid many times, and never been disappointed. With such a central location you are able to visit all the main sights on foot without having to consider public transport; making more time to enjoy yourself. It is family run and the rooms and public spaces are clean and functional; this building is steeped in history and therefore different from so many of the chain hotels which are bland. Breakfast is served on a roof top terrace offering unusual views of the city and a feeling of escapism. Yes, there are limited facilities compared to other hotels in Rome, but what it offers is a great location, a beautiful building, large clean en-suit bedrooms and friendly helpful service from staff; that are always happy to help (and speak Italian & English!) Defiantly worth a visit when in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Overrated”
Reviews.Author: hristine
Reviews.Content: (+) The hotel is located near the Spanish Steps, as well as the most commercial/fashion roads of rome (i.e. via Condotti, via Frattina, Via del Corso). It is a great starting point for itineraries throughout the city of Rome. The staff is friendly and helpful and the hotel in general is clean and hygenic. Good price for the internet. Breakfast is also a "plus". (-) The rooms are old fashioned, very small and the overall decoration is..."kitsch" I would say! The price we payed (250 euros/per night) is too much for this kind of a hotel!!! I don't know if this high price is due to the fact that we visited Rome during the beatification of the Pope, but I wouldn' t suggest to anyone to pay such a high price for such a hotel......

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay for families in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Yountville01
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Very comfortable accomadation for families. Great location. Reasonably/fairly priced. Would stay here every time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Jane R
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five and stayed here for five nights in January in their family suite. It is in such a great location very close to the Spanish Steps and a Metro station. We were able to walk easily to many of the sights such as the Trevi Fountain, the Villa Borghese, Piazza Navona, Vatican City and the Colosseum and then catch the Metro back if we were tired. The room was great value and spacious enough for the five of us, there were two separate rooms with one bathroom. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room included breakfast on the roof top with views of St Paul's. Great cappucinos and hot chocolates were enjoyed each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, very nice room”
Reviews.Author: MarcioHaddad
Reviews.Content: Excelent location. Very comfortable room and a big and clean bathroom. It really is worth for the price. I would highly recommend it for any kind of travellers. Bad points: WiFi Internet only in the hotel lobby and you must be careful with airport pick up arrangements offered by the staff. In my case, although the driver was cordial, he was late and charged us a different price from what we arranged. 5 Euros only but we did not see any reason for this.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseShergold00
Reviews.Content: Hotel Madrid was the perfect hotel for us right in the heart of Rome amidst restraunts and great shopping. It was 5mins walk to the Metro, Spanish steps, and Trevi fountain. A walk, even though a bit further , to the Collesseum and Vittorio Emanuelle monument as well. Antonio on the desk was fantastic - very helpful with confirmimg our flights on departure and generally directing us around town. Breakfast was fresh, and selection was great - beautiful pastries and variety, all served in a lovely little rooftop cafe with great service. The outside is being renovated at present but I would certainly return and stay there when back in Rome !!

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: RiMo3
Reviews.Content: I booked our two day stay in this hotel based on reviews found on Tripadvisor. A great find in a great location in Rome. Convenient to Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, Vatican City and may other sites. Hotel was also within walking distance to the train station which is how we arrived in Rome. Despite the renovation work taking place on the exterior of the building, it was a great stay. The renovation work will only be an improvement to this great little find in Rome. A big plus was the included breakfast that came with our stay. This was a great way to kick off the day as we made our way to the various sites in this amazing city. Antonio, who ran the front desk was extremely friendly from the moment we arrived to the day we departed. He was very friendly and very helpful with any questions we had. I would also like to add that the staff at breakfast was also very friendly and great with the service they provided. Overall we had an excellent stay at this hotel and would return again. Great job by all at the Hotel Madrid! Grazie!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: Deanna12
Reviews.Content: this was our second stay, three nights before cruise. The location is terrific and the rooms comfortably accomodate a family of four. We will go back. Deanna Sgro

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, and NOT only !”
Reviews.Author: claudia_micallef
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a marvellous 3 day stay in Rome with my sister. This is our second stay at the Hotel Madrid, and we intend staying in this same hotel next time round. Each time we feel welcome at the Madrid, the staff are very helpful, accommodating and friendly. The breakfast is a Continental Buffet breakfast, really good... choice of scrabbled eggs, bacon, ham, salami, cheeses, yogurts, fresh bread, different pastries and last but not least the mouth watering croissants stuffed with Nutella chocolate! It is such a pleasant surpise, when reaching the top floor enclosed roof garden, location for the breafkast area with a view of St Peter's Basilica ( Vatican) and Rome's roof tops ! The bedrooms & bathrooms are very clean, and the bed linen and bath towels are always very white and spotless. A chocolate is placed on your pillow upon arrival & its good chocolate :) The location is simply superb, on your door step you are within a couple of minutes to the Spanish Steps and Via Condotti, and 6 minute walk to Via del Corso. Its also easy and comfortable to walk to Fontana di Trevi, or to Piazza del Popolo, no hills in these directions. The hotel is so central, these places can be visited by also taking a stroll at night time. Claudia from Malta

Reviews.Title: “Will go back in a heartbeat!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sjava911
Reviews.Content: Hotel Madrid is a perfect place to stay in Rome. Great location, efficient and friendly staff, lovely and clean. The breakfast is so lovely...can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pivilee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel with our 3 children. The room was big enough for us five (we've been in much smaller ones, too). The breakfast was very nice and the view from the breakfast room was excellent. The location couldn't have been better and the staff was really nice and helpful (special thanks to the nice lady in breakfast room and the gentlemen at the reception who arranged us taxis and restaurant reservations!). On Friday and Saturday evening the noice from the night club next door disturbed us a little bit - but that was the only thing I can complain in the hotel. Very nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: boxerinno
Reviews.Content: I've been to Hotel Madrid more than once and my last visit and fresh visit was in the beginning of September. My pals and I stayed there for five days and boy oh boy, it was as good as it always has been. It's... You know... one of those places that sticks to its quality and self set standards. Personally, I love having breakfast and Hotel Madrid is the only hotel I don't do room service simply because I love mingling with other guests and their terrace makes me feel like I'm in one of those Hollywood movies - the view of the Roman rooftops takes me breath away, those white metal chairs, nicely decorated tables + fresh cornetto & cappuccino.... Yep, heaven with a full stomach & set for a day in this eternal city which I love so much. It amazes me how central it is and yet I've never heard a single sound from the street. The staff at the front desk is really nice and although some of them have changed with years (I went there in spring '99, fall '03 and like a month ago), I still felt like they knew I was a returning guest. I like it's both homey and professional service; the rooms are cozy and impeccably clean, bathrooms have enough space and you know I'm a sucker for those tiny soaps and shampoos.... i have a small collection at home and every time I need a pick me up to refresh my memory and instantly take me to my fave place, I smell them. I do the same with their soaps, with turkish delights from Istanbul, etc. To cut it short, I absolutely love hotel Madrid and can't wait to come again and again. I give it five stars and wholeheartedly recommend, both for families with kids and for singles and/or couples. Frankly, I think this hotel really is a true gem. And yeah, their rates are amazing, especially having in mind it's terrific location. I'm sure you'll enjoy it as much as I have.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JHM_76
Reviews.Content: Hotel Madrid was disappointing for the price. The room was small, stuffy and claustrophobic. The front of house staff were friendly enough, but not overly helpful. Breakfast was the worst. My husband and I were asked on several occasions to move to make way for families. Often there weren't enough tables for all the guests and we were left standing. The waitress was extremely rude, especially when I had breakfast on my own one morning because my husband thought it wasn't worth the hassle. She made me move for a family and then ignored all my requests for tea. We weren't overly enamoured with Rome - it's not a place for young couples - we spent all our time out because the hotel was so lousy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Natale12
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Hotel Madrid and we were very pleased. the location cannot be beat and the quad rooms are relatively spacious. We stayed for three nights before heading to Civitavecchia for a 12 day cruise. We particularly enjoyed breakfast and how centrally located the hotel is. Minutes from the spanish steps, Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and the Collisseum. Love Rome Deanna Natale

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: rg66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotels in Rome, San Gimingnano, Venice, and Giovinazzo, and Hotel Madrid in Rome was our favorite. My family of 5 was able to stay in one room, the suite, and it was perfect for us. My 12 and 15 yr old boys were comfortable in their separate sleeping area of the suite. This hotel has a great location, we walked to everything! The breakfast on the rooftop was so nice. All the staff in this hotel were so friendly and helpful. We were recommended this hotel by family members and we were happy with the results. Very clean also.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms good location”
Reviews.Author: TimHues
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice here. The staff are friendly. Try not to get a pool facing room as it can be noisy, but the pool itself is fantastic to use. There are wonderful places to eat near by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and staff!”
Reviews.Author: jujulouro
Reviews.Content: excellent location! the overall decor is very tacky but the rooms are good. the breakfast is a bit weak though.... Our first night was terrible, our air conditioning didnt work, it was mid summer, 90 degrees out, our room was a sauna and we had a hard time sleeping. However, we complained first thing in the morning, the staff called maintenance and when we came back in the end of the day they moved us to a new room, spacier and with excellent air conditioning! so, thumbs up to that! thumbs down for not having wi fi in the rooms! they only have wi fi in the lobby, and there only two tiny couches, so its not the most comfortable situation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adn232
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Rome for the first time with my wife and son. I booked a triple room for 4 nights. My son slept on the couch which was converted into a bed. The room was very clean, a little mold in the shower, but not a big deal. The staff was very helpful and courteous. They were able to answer any questions we had relating to tourist sites and transportation. The breakfast in the morning is your standard american buffet; eggs, ham, bread, milk, orange juice, and pastries. The location is great. Only two blocks or so away from the Spanish Steps, about a 5 minute walk to the Trevi fountain, a bit more than 10 minutes walking distance to the Pantheon, and a reasonable walk to the Colosseum. I would definitely recommend this hotel for those who are looking for a hotel in walking distance to the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Courtious Staff, but definitely not a 3-star hotel by US Standards”
Reviews.Author: Rup22000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two days of our honeymoon. I was very surprised to find upon arrival that the hotel is only vaguely similar to the pictures on it's website. It was clean, the location was great, the staff was OK. However, I learned my lesson that 3-stars in Italy is equivalent to a Days Inn in the U.S. U.S residents traveling to Rome for the first time, take note that to get the type of accommodations you would expect from an Hampton Inn, you need to go 4-star or better. The frustrating aspect of my trip is that the hotel looks mildly romantic with warm, inviting rooms. However, I learned quickly by my wife's reaction that this place will not inspire any type of romance. Therefore, I would not recommend this place for newlyweds on a honeymoon. Another disappointing thing was that the room was 220-240 Euro per night so it wasn't exactly cheap. Would I stay here again? Yes if I couldn't afford a 4-star or better and just wanted a place to lay my head. Good: -close to Metro -high end shopping very nearby -breakfast was good, especially the cappuccino -free WiFi -staff is courteous, but there are some negatives listed below Bad: -no wash cloths in the bathroom -rooms are outdated and look much better on the website than in person -small elevator -room is expensive for what you get (but that's all of Rome in general) -staff: staff recommended a restaurant nearby that didn't exist so we wasted 1 hr looking for it, language barrier was a problem

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Happy32655
Reviews.Content: located right in the historical and cultural center and near great restaurants. Clean and comfortable. The hotel managers, Antonio and Luciano were very helpful and went out of thier way meet our needs. I am so grateful to Luciano who arranged to get Fed Ex to come and pick up a box of all the souveneers and personal items that we needed to mail home before we left for the Amalfi.. Though they were extremely busy most of the time due to staff shortage,these two guys just couldn't do enough for us to make our stay a pleasant experiance. The breakfast was great and the dinning room provides a fantastic view of Rome

Reviews.Title: “An ideal location and clean spacious suite for families”
Reviews.Author: nicky065
Reviews.Content: The hotel Madrid is in an ideal location, near the Spanish steps. We were there for 3 nights in April with 3 teenagers and stayed in one of the Suites for 5 people. We could walk to all of the central attactions and there were great restaurants and a lively atmosphere all day and evening in all of the narrow streets around the hotel. The suite was spacious even with 3 large teenagers and the rooms and bathroom were very clean. The breakfast was plenty to start off the day and the staff were very helpful and could speak good english. The only downside was the cost which I think was down to the central location!

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: jrichardson-KY
Reviews.Content: Six of us recently spent a week at the Hotel Madrid and thought it was a very good experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were not undersized, as some European hotels can be. It is well taken care of and the rooftop terrace is just a beautful place to have breakfast each day. It is a tad pricey for the budget traveler (ours was 320 Euro per night), but located in the midst of the many Roman tourist locations. Sleep quality was hit and miss, mostly because we would leave our windows open for traffic on the street to wake us. Only minor complaint was that the free wi-fi was only accessible in the lobby, not in the rooms. But, I am a computer geek, so this won't bother most travelers. :>

Reviews.Title: “A lovely gem in the heart of Old Rome.”
Reviews.Author: KYPetalPusher
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long family trip to Rome. We stayed at Hotel de Madrid and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location was great --- convenient to everything. Our room was very clean every day and quite comfortable. The staff was more than accomodating for anything we needed. The rooftop garden where we ate breakfast everyday was such a peaceful place to start your day (Ileni, the breakfast attendant that made cappucinos, teas, etc was a joy to meet.). I would definitely return! My only note would be to extend the Wi-Fi signal to the rooms and not just the lobby. Thanks for everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Partyoffive-2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Madrid for 3 nights with 3 children (Ages G17, G15 and B10), we booked the family suite for 5. We had 2 rooms and 1 bathroom, the "master" had an extra bed, and the exterior room had 2 twin beds. It was small but comfortable. The room was clean and the location of this hotel was excellent. We arrived at the Termini Stazione and we were able to take the "A" line train 3 stops to "Spagna", the hotel is 3 minutes walking from the Metro Stop and the Spanish Steps. The individuals working the front desk are very attentive and will answer all of your questions. With older kids; we were able to get around Rome by purchasing a day pass for 4 EUR on the bus and Metro. It is easy to use and we were able to see the entire city. You can't beat this hotel for its fabulous location (right by the Spanish Steps) and near the Trevi Fountain, yet on a quieter street.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SergeStorms
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in April. It's a small hotel with clean areas and rooms. Rooms were similar to US size. The location was fantastic, walked everywhere. Front desk staff helpful. Breakfast was included and good. Only real downsides were price and no WiFi in rooms, only lobby. Price was competitive compared to other hotels for same dates, just seemed expensive for the type of accommodations and amenities. We'd have no reservations staying here again but would research more for better pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel, super service. Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: figolino1
Reviews.Content: If you love culture, shopping, great food, cosy restaurants/cafees and you want it to be "10 steps away" so you can "roll" to the hotel, this is the "creme de la creme" of it all!! The best shopping is 30 seconds away, you can shop and go to the hotel and leave the bags, and in a matter of seconds be back shopping again. The "Spanish Stairs" are a minute walk away, and so is the rest of central Rome. The hotel is splendid. The rooms, all of which newly renovated, are cosy, and the rich breakfast on top of the hotel, gives a great view of the rooftops of Rome. The service is friendly, professional, extremely kind and the staff is superb. Truly recommandable!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute hotel, updated private bathrooms! Amazing breakfast room!”
Reviews.Author: denverchic
Reviews.Content: The bed was a bit outdated but comfortable enough. The bathroom as an updated modern italian style bathroom. By far and away the best feature of the hotel is the rooftop breakfast room. A hotel staff member was there making espresso drinks. The breakfast layout was standard but what a great wat to start your day in Rome (overlooking the city)! The location is great to. We are New Yorkers so we're used to walking, but we were able to walk just about everywhere we wanted to go. The spanish steps are 2 blocks away along with some high end shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price but a few wrinkles”
Reviews.Author: cmosydney
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Madrid can't be beaten, located a short walk from the Spanish Steps and fabulous shopping, and I walked to areas further away including the Colosseum. The rooms are average but comfortable enough, I was located on the top floor which is where the rooftop area for breakfast is. A couple of things bothered me - there were cigarette burns in my sheets and the bedspread, and the water pressure in the shower was non-existent. I left the window open once and pigeons flew in and left some droppings on the floor, but I can't blame the hotel for that. I found the breakfast pretty awful and the coffee not up to Italian standards at all. However overall this hotel is excellent value for the location and the staff are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great safe location, plentiful breakfast, plush bathroom, and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: bec228
Reviews.Content: I'm late in writing a review but am returning in July 2010. What a great hotel deal! Stayed with my 85 yr.old mother and we felt very safe walking to and from. The staff was eager to help in every way. Breakfast is plentiful. Room wasn't plush but for the great price am booking my husband's family for 3 nights in Rome. Also my son met us for a few nights and this is one of the few hotels that could accommodate 3 in a room with a single extra bed. Room was tight but we did fine. And the price was so great for that area. I liked that it was off the busy street but still felt close for walking and safe at night. Bec228

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for location but average accommodation , overall”
Reviews.Author: pervanet
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location in the historic and commercial center of Eternal Rome. In view of the prices that they charge per room , the hotel is in need of some extensive modernization to its almost non existing facilities . Claustophobic lift, antiquated TV sets, no wi-fi connection in rooms, no working mini-bar, broken toilet cistern.To this I may add the lack of porter assistance, the noise from passers-by and scooters from the street below, the absolute minimal hotel reception lobby etc. Unique pleasant feature of this establishment is the breakfast room on the roof terrace with commanding views of the famous Roman terraces and the cupola of St. Peters' Cathedral in the distant background. Conclusion: This is a "sleep and go" hotel.If one wants to walk the very heart of the historic center of Rome for shopping or cultural therapy, in good sunshine weather, so that rain does not force you in the room, this place will do. If one is not fussy about facilities, frills and charm , this place will do, too. If you are on a tight budget this place will not do.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Madrid-A good choice”
Reviews.Author: peanut7h
Reviews.Content: Hello- I stayed at Hotel Madrid in early October for 3 nights. I booked the Hotel via venere website (but I noticed I would have received a cheaper rate if I just booked on the hotel website). Anyway, I was nervous about this hotel because of some of the reviews. I e-mailed them in advance and confirmation directly from the hotel was received. Our transfer limo driver easily found the hotel and was able to drop us off at the front door. The limo driver remarked to us that we picked a hotel with a perfect location. The gentleman working the desk helped us move our luggage from the van into the hotel by the desk and then helped us move the luggage to the elevator (much appreciated!). We checked in at 11:00am (early) and the room was ready. Check in was easy and quick. The elevator to the room worked well (we were on the 3rd floor), with a nice large bed. I was impressed at first glance with the bathroom and bedroom (roomy and clean, no foul odor). It was hot in the room when we first arrived so we closed the windows and turned on the AC which worked fine. Also, the safe was a nice touch and it worked fine too. Bathroom was beautiful and shower pressure was fine (I read another comment that stated poor water pressure which was not the case). Plenty of nice hot water for a long shower. Couldn't find any evidence of mold, dirt or anything to complain about at all. Nice size desk, armoire with 10 hangers. There were no drawers or dressers so we basically just kept everything folded in our suitcases and lived out of them. Also no alarm clock but a working phone and the front desk does wake up calls as needed. Hotel is nice and quiet (which I was worried about because last time I was in Rome I stayed on via del corso which was very loud!!). Also thick curtains help to block out sunlight if you want to sleep in, or they can be pulled back for light. I had read a review that rooms were small so I made sure to book the double superior which was a perfect size!! The price was normal for a big city, and it is similar to other hotels in the area. You are staying in an area with a perfect location for sightseeing and by all the high end shopping (and very safe). If you want a cheap hotel (like near the train station), you are going to pay in other ways (lack of safety, not being able to go outside at night....). Also, there is a minibar in the room with prices listed on the desk. Maid service did a good job. TV is small and English stations were CNN international and MTV. Wi-fi available in lobby area. Breakfast was served 7am-10am in the morning buffet style, and consisted of fruit, pasteries, cereal, yogurt, eggs (scrambled and hard boiled), french toast and bacon. Also assorted juices, water and coffee was available. So yummy, perfect breakfast!! Probably the best free breakfast I have ever had at a hotel. The view from the roof-top terrace is nice and you can see St. Peters. Although, there is a picture that someone took of the view from the window to St. Peters, but it is misleading (I think they zoomed in alot for there picture, the Basilica isn't actually that close). We walked alot to different places in Rome. For shopping Via Condotti and Via Del Corso are within minutes walking and then you can walk to other sites like Spanish Steps (5 minutes), Colesseum (25 minutes), Forum/Circus Maximus (30 minutes), Vatican (40 minutes). Cab ride to Vatican was 10 euros from hotel so we decided to walk afterwards back to the hotel. It was a pleasant walk passing Castle Sant Angelo and crossing the river. Make sure if you need a transfer/taxi to the airport you only accept a flat rate of 40 euro. I think that the hotel driver charges 50 euros. Oh- and make sure that if you are taking a direct flight back to the US they drop you off at terminal T5 at the airport (new terminal for direct Israel and US flights). Plenty of bars and restaurant within 5 minutes walking from hotel. My overall impression is that it was a good hotel to stay at and I would stay there again. It is an old building but everything was clean (i.e. no rotting wood, no stains on walls, no ragged carpet). In other words, the building doesn't show signs of its age. It was alot of money to stay there but you are paying for location, safety and a good hotel in a large city. I have paid similar prices for far less charming hotels. I rated it a 4 because I thought it was very good for a 3 star hotel. I would say if you are going for more business interests or looking for complete luxury to stay elsewhere. This is just the perfect charming hotel for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “All in all good”
Reviews.Author: SydV3
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, nice and helpful staff and brilliant location. Breakfast was lovely too.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced for the quality”
Reviews.Author: Frank_am_Main
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great position right in the middle or Rome few meters from the spanish steps. Unbeatable. The hotel however is very old and run down. Bathroom especially was small and the showere did not have enough pressure . Wi-fi only available in the (small) lobby. For the price of 170 Euro I paid this was really overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in the best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: boncharle
Reviews.Content: We were traveling in a group of five staying in Rome just one night before our Tuscany trip began. We loved it so much that we decided to change our hotels for the end of our trip back to Hotel Madrid and the same room. We booked the Hotel Madrid from ratings on this website and have nothing but great remarks. Wonderful staff...the desk staff (Tony, Max and Luciano) very helpful and customer-oriented. The woman, I feel bad I cannot remember her name, who made our cappuccino and breakfast was absolutely wonderful. We looked forward seeing her and having a great start to our day. There were five of us (all women) and we stayed in the room with five beds, one bath. Yes, it was a little tight for us to have only one bathroom but we loved sharing our late nights reviewing all the events of the day. We are planning on returning next year for addtiional tours of Italy and the Hotel Madrid is on the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: gyrocompass
Reviews.Content: Location...Hotel Madrid is located in an ideal location with a 2min walk to the Spagna Metro and 20min walk to the Vatican and a 15min walk to Villa Borghese. We really enjoyed just walking around a night (i.e. Trevi, pantheon, spanish steps) and not being more than 10mins from our Hotel. This being our first trip to Rome, we were a little overwhelmed by all the hotel choices, but we were 100% happy with this choice. The staff was friendly and helpful, although we did not ask for much since we like to explore ourselves. The superior double room is adequately sized (on the smaller side), but we didn't spend much time in the room. Breakfeast on the rooftop was pretty good with scrambled eggs and "bacon". Only a view of other rooftops though. Overall, great hotel and provided a relaxing haven from all the tourist stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: mylifemyway111
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was very professional, friendly and eager to please. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I was in touch with them by email numerous times before our trip. They always responded quickly. I especially like the fact that the hotel staff spoke English (as this was our first visit to Rome and we had many questions). The rooms were very nice (clean and large) with a plasma TV and fridge. The hotel staff even helped us book sight-seeing tours through an outside agency. The tour agency came to the hotel to pick us up and dropped us off at the end. The continental breakfast is served each morning on the roof-top terrace overlooking the city of Rome. What better way to start off your day! The only draw back to this charming hotel is the fact that you have to climb multiple stairs to reach your room or the roof-top terrace. The hotel's elevator only fits 2 people at a time (or your luggage) and it was much quicker and faster to just take the stairs. After a long day of sight-seeing and walking around, it would have been nice to take the elevator to our rooms. Other than this, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great staff, Great location! Second stay and still great!”
Reviews.Author: pizzsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a perfect section of Rome, right around the block from the Spanish Steps and close to all the shopping!! Bus depot to all areas of Rome is one block down from the hotel which makes it very easy to get around! The staff is very friendly, courteous and helpful.. the rooms are spacious..great big bathroom for Rome hotels and very clean and neat! The breakfast on the rooftop has a beautiful view of the city....you will not regret staying at this hotel! Great find that we have already used twice while going through Rome and will use again and again!

Reviews.Title: “A small gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: asmets41
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. 4 of us stayed in a 2 room suite that was clean and comfortable. This was our first trip to Europe so we weren't used to the air conditioning turning off when we left the room, a bathroom that didn't have A/C, etc. We decided to stay here based upon the reviews and that it was one of a few hotels that could accomodate the 4 of us in 3 separate beds. The front desk was always helpful in directing us to dinner, the subway, etc. The free breakfast was good, with an assortment of pastry, cereal, eggs, bacon, and fruits. There was free WiFi in the lobby. The hotel is located a few blocks from the Spanish steps and within easy walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and Piazza Navona. Services are minimal if you are looking for Spa treatments, room service, workout room, etc, then you should find a bigger, more well known hotel. If you want comfort, cleanliness for a reasonable price I would highley rate this conveinently located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: marytwhite
Reviews.Content: Family trip with two teenagers in a suite for a very reasonable rate in Rome in a perfect location, right in the heart of the "La Dolce Vita Walk" so close to Spanish steps, Metro subway stop, high end shopping and restaurants. Hotel is very very clean, nice bathroom, plenty of space and nice breakfast. We ordered a quad room and good a 2-room suite. The kids loved having their own space and privacy. Would highly recommend Hotel Madrid to anyone. Italy is EXTREMELY hot in August, keep this in mind when planning a trip - I would go again in spring or fall.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: fermal
Reviews.Content: Three star hotel with a great location. The staff is very friendly. Cute terrace to have breakfast with views of Rome. Keep in mind that what you pay is what to get. Do not expect five star service.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tjv4989
Reviews.Content: This was a very good 3 star hotel remember its not a 5 star.We stayed in the 5 person suite it was nice .1 bathroom gets tricky at times.The best part of this hotel is the location.There is a very nice hotel across the street called hotel homs that looked nice

Reviews.Title: “Everything is true”
Reviews.Author: snowbunnii
Reviews.Content: Everything you've read about this establishment is true! Clean comfortable rooms, excellent location, with super friendly staff. We couldn't recommend Madrid Hotel more highly! When returning to Rome will stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in every aspect!”
Reviews.Author: QC-on-the-go
Reviews.Content: Service, cleanliness, location, room, bathroom, terrace... everything was fabulous. Antonio and Luciano at the front desk were so helpful and polite. The view from the terrace at breakfast was exceptional. The breafast-lady remembered how we liked our coffees. So much attention to small details.The free internet worked really well. Quiet street. Close to everything. Stayed 3 days but will stay longer next time. Ann (Montreal Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spiketop
Reviews.Content: If a 3 star hotel is what you are looking for this place is excellent. Service desk is very helpful. I was given a room on a high floor with plenty of natural light... just as I requested. The location is perfect... you are walking distance to everything. The breakfast is fine if not amazing and I enjoyed the rooftop view from the breakfast room. The room was larger than most Rome hotel rooms for this price. I only gave it a 4 (rather than 5) rating because at the end of the day this won't be the most amazing hotel you've ever stayed in... but it will be very comfortable, very affordable, very clean, and very well located for travelers looking for a hotel rated somewhere between economy and luxury. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Woody-Family
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our family of four. We had a suite for four people which we booked online with the hotel directly. We had a good sized double room and a separate adjoining twin room for the kids. The room was kept very clean and we didn’t find the noise a problem as we shut the shutters inside and out and kept the air conditioning units on in both rooms. The breakfast was good but it is best to get there early so you have more choice of pastries. We had very good bruschetta on Sunday morning! They ask you if you would like a drink from the bar, and so we ordered cappuccinos which are included in the price. The hotel gives you a very good map of Rome which we found invaluable as it was very detailed. We had heard from reviews on Trip Advisor that there is a 10% discount if you pay in cash, but the hotel staff were a bit vague for a few days about whether we could have this discount or not, but after checking with the manager it was all agreed and this was not a problem. The hotel is perfectly placed for loads of good bars and restaurants and is only a few minutes walk away from the Spanish Steps. We also walked to the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon and up the Piazza del Popolo, where there are great views over the city if you walk up to the Pincio. We did walk a bit further to Piazza Navona which is a lovely square full of nice bars and restaurants and lots of painters selling their pictures. We would recommend a restaurant called Zio Ciro (part of a chain) which is up the road first right as you come out of the hotel entrance. This was the only restaurant we could find that did cheap house wine in a carafe rather than in a bottle. It was 5 Euros for a half litre carafe and the food was good too. We got taxis to the Colosseum and the Vatican to save our kids from moaning and these were reasonably priced. It was very easy to get a taxi as there were taxis parked in Piazza Miganelli just up from the hotel. You can also get taxis near the Spanish Steps and they are waiting for you outside the Vatican museum. If you get to the Colosseum early enough you can just walk straight in with hardly any queue, we got there for 9am but it actually opens at 8.30am. We booked our tickets to the Vatican museum online and this saved us from having to queue up outside the museum, you just walk straight in. But you do still have to queue up to exchange your voucher for tickets at the ticket desks (there are priority ones for online bookings) but the queues here were very small. I would recommend climbing the dome at St Peter’s as this was great fun for the kids. Just follow the signs for the Cupola when you are in the queue for St Peters. We chose to take the lift for the first bit but walked up the remaining steps.

Reviews.Title: “We've found our hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Reds9908
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an unpretentious, clean, well-appointed and friendly hotel in an excellent location then this is the place for you. We've stayed at the swanky 4 and 5 stars on the Via Veneto, but they really can't compare with the welcome and personal attention we encountered at the Hotel Madrid. It is within easy walking distance of many of the must-see sights, and very close to the Piazza di Spagna Metro for trips further afield (St Peter's, the Colosseum). Breakfast on the enclosed roof terrace was a delight ~ a lovely way to start the day. You won't see gilt decorations and chandeliers in the lobby; there is no over-priced hotel restaurant or trendy bar. Instead, you get value for money, friendly staff, a lovely clean room with very good quality bathroom, towels, bedding etc. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice”
Reviews.Author: SharonBarron
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful surprise. We booked on the basis of location and economy and were bowled over by the wonderful welcome that we received. All staff were unfailingly charming and attentive. Breakfasting on the rooftop terrace was delightful. The room was comfortable, the airconditioning was extremely efficient (our stay coincided with a heatwave) and we were not bothered by any noise from outside. We would definitely stay at the Madrid on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but not great - Tripadvisor let me down”
Reviews.Author: CodyDC
Reviews.Content: When traveling I always use TripAdvisor for Hotel and Attraction recommends. This is the first time the reviews of TripAdvisor let me down. The hotel was ok but not what I expected based on the reviews. Biggest complaint was the noise factor - noise from the hotel and bar next door and from the rooms next door. The breakfast was nice and being next to the Metro was very good - just 2 stops to the Central Train Station. Hotel was about 20-30 walk to both Vatican and Colosseum so I did a lot walking. 20/20 hindsight, not sure which is the best location for hotel in Rome, but I think the hotel is over-priced. Hotel staff was great so no complaints with the service. The free Wifi was only in the hotel lobby and not in the rooms - it worked the first night but not my other 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: dallasfamily6
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on a recommendation from a friend, and we were not disappointed. The location is near the Spanish Steps, metro, American Express office and Borghese Gardens. The rooms were spotless, roomy, quiet and comfortable. We had a quad and a double. Breakfast on the enclosed rooftop terrace was lovely. Hotel staff was friendly and accomodating. We highly recommend Hotel Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, perfect location, you will not be disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: laparo
Reviews.Content: I was nicely surprised. I got much more than expected. Location as said perfect, the service incredible, always at your service. Let us not a beautiful roof terrace to enjoy your breakfast. Full value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Govfam
Reviews.Content: My wife and two young boys (ages 9 & 6) stayed here for four nights. We had a wonderful time. The hotel is ideally located with all the major attractions either a short walk away or a few stops on public transportation. The staff are very knowledgeable and helpful and made our stay very pleasant. We stayed in a family room which was clean, comfortable & roomy for the four of us. However you do have to remember to close all the windows before going to bed otherwise you'll be woken up by the street sounds, but I think this is a problem faced by all the hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “we loved Hotel Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Naperville854
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Madrid. Location was excellent. Within walking distance to everything. Staff very helpful. Hotel breakfast is included and good. Cappuccino at breakfast was incredible. We were there over New Years with our children ages 8 and 11. Hotel fit the four of us perfectly. We had a room with two single beds and a queen. Big bathrooms (for Europe).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: windsordeb
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel in a safe area for our family as we knew we would be walking back with our teen daughters at night. This was a perfect location - near all of the high end designer stores and the Spanish Steps. It really felt safe because there are so many people out looking at the shops, eating at the many restaurants, and taking pictures of the beautiful fountains in the area. This hotel is also convenient to everything - the metro is nearby, a taxi stand is on the corner, but you can also just walk with one of the tourist maps they give you. I was surprised to see how walkable Rome was. What looked like a long walk was only about 15 minutes. The staff was very helpful, I liked the system of leaving your key at the front desk (no worries about losing it), they made great coffee and hot chocolate in the morning, the breakfast was nice and the rooms were a bit bigger than most of Europe. Also, the bathrooms were either brand new or super clean. The shower/sink/floor/toilet looked like they just bought them new from the showroom. It was also a bigger bathroom than those we've had in other cities in Europe. There was some street noise, but if you closed the windows it blocked it out really well. We were on the 1st floor, so being higher probably would have helped also. I would recommend this hotel - it was convenient to everything and the area was a good one. They also arranged our transportation to and from the airport in a van (because we had a lot of luggage) - so that was convenient and on time both ways.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, helped with museumreservations”
Reviews.Author: Ready2Go2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near the Spanish Steps, the various ride-around-tourist buses,and the subway. The roof dining room is lovely. The hotel was very helpful in securing reservations for museums (except the Vatican, which doesn't work with anyone except the scalpers) and saved us a lot of hassle. I recommend this hotel highly,with two caveats: there are some groups of 2or 3 steps when you enter ---may not be suitable for some people; also many of the local restaurants cater to tourists - ask the conceirge for suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel Near Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunners1
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the Hotel Madrid after a cruise. The selection was due to a number of good travel site reviews that we also found to be accurate. The rooms were good size and the bathrooms very clean and large. Excellent cleanliness and attention to detail. The location is excellent – easy walking to Spanish steps area, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Via Veneto, located in the shopping triangle and in good location to walk to two stops of the Metro (minutes to Vatican or Colosseum). The staff was always helpful and considerate. The breakfast is in the fifth floor restaurant and patio that allows you to see St Peters and many of the northwest Rome sights. For first time visitors to Rome our web search gave us an excellent hotel for the price – highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming - Started to feel like home”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTripster2008
Reviews.Content: What a delightful hotel. Clean, great staff and great breakfast in the morning. They were absolutely delightful and responded immediately to any problems, often going beyond the call of duty. The location is excellent but like most of Rome's streets, built on cobblestone so one has to maneuver carefully and avoid being the moving target of cars and scooters. The restaurant around the corner and up two doors is excellent and quite moderately priced. The wine is 4.50 Euros for 1/2 a litre - cheaper than soft drinks and the food is excellent. Its part of a chain - an orange sign. walk down the streeet from the Hotel Madrid and you will see it. Also, situated on the next block but to be avoided at all costs is the Caffeteria Antica Roma on Via di Propaganda, 26/B - an absolutel total rip off .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: JwtKensington
Reviews.Content: Hotel Madrid was excellent. My husband and I with our two teenagers(15 and 13 years old) stayed for 6 days in July. The location of the hotel was perfect. The Hotel is right around the corner from the Spanish Steps and subway. We used the subway often. We found a favorite restaurant just steps away from the hotel. The breakfast was included in the room rate and was perfect for everyone. The hotel staff was great and helped us with transportation from the airport to the hotel and then to the port of Civitavecchia for our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: jrd18
Reviews.Content: At the very last minute we switched our hotel from the Westin to here and are extremely glad we did. The location was perfect and no more than 15 minute walk to all the historic sites. During the hot summer days, it was great to be able to walk back to the hotel, cool off and nap and then be close enough to walk the city again at night. As many of the other reviewers have commented, the front desk staff is super helpful. The rooms were very clean and the size expected for Europe. Wish the bed was not so hard, but I think that is also customary for Europe. The breakfast is adequate - the coffee was fabulous though. Especially given the Euro to $ ratio, having breakfast included at a decent price was really a savings. The flowers on the roof garden were really nice to look at in the morning. Would definitely recommend this hotel (and liked this better than our 5 star Westin which we ended up going to for the weekend on points).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cooks5
Reviews.Content: We were two families of 5 (4 adults, 6 kids under 14) and found the Hotel Madrid to be perfect for our group. We each had family suites which had 3 single beds in one room and a king sized bed in the other, separated by a door. The rooms were very spacious and clean and had efficient A/C units that kept things nice and cool. The bathroom was very large and bright and, dare I say, luxurious. For Europe, the bath/shower was exceptionally large. The location of the hotel could not be better. A 5 minute walk and you were at the Spanish Steps metro stop. Many sites were just a short walk away - Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Borghese Gardens, etc. A short metro ride and you were in Ancient Rome near the Colosseum, Palatine Hill, etc. or The Vatican City. The desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delightful with hot items (scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, croissants) as well as fabulous cappuccino. It is all served on a lovely rooftop terrace where you can see across the city. We loved this hotel - by far the best we stayed in while in Italy. Would definitely recommend it. Two notes of interest though... beware the "fancy gelatteria" around the corner (I can't remember the name but the desk personnel knew it immediately when I complained!) Without going into too much detail, suffice to say that they are dishonest and rude, not to mention extremely pricey. Also, the hotel is on a very tight back street so definitely don't plan to drive yourself to the hotel. Take the train in and have a taxi deal with getting you to the hotel! The ride there was quite exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AJRSalisbury
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay in the Madrid Hotel in Rome. The location is ideal and is within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. The Rooms are clean with nice bathrooms and the breakfast is your usual continental style with pastries, rolls, cereal & fruit. We stayed in a suite which had a double bed in one room and 2 singles in the room next door. The hotel do not provide a iron or ironing board. We were told that in Italy, they were not allowed to provide these for public use in hotels, so if you need an iron I suggest you take a travel iron. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms, but there is a small fridge/mini-bar. There can be a bit of noise from the bar/club on Via Della Vite so we were glad of the shutters and air conditioning to drown out the noise. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The Spagna metro is closeby where you can take the tube to the Vatican & the Colloseum. If you like shopping Gucci, Valentino, Jimmy Choo, Prada and many more are just around the corner. There are also plenty of restaurants in the area. I would advise to take comfortable walking shoes as the surrounding streets are all narrow and cobbled - not too good for stilleto heels. I booked directly with the hotel on their website - www.hotelmadridroma.com. They will give you 10% discount if you settle your bill by cash. I would most definitely return to Rome and stay at the hotel Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: kmostrach
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are on the small side, they are very clean. Bathrooms were spacious and modern. We did not spend much time in the rooms, except to get over jet lag the first day. Breakfast is included and it was excellent, something for everyone at their rooftop garden including great cappuccino and hot chocolate for the kids. The location is amazing--right around the corner from the Spanish Steps, very safe, less than a 10 minute walk to the Metro. We easily strolled to the Borghese Gardens (up the Spanish Steps and to the left) where my 7 year old took a carousel ride at a little park, they could also rent bikes. Ten minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, 15 minutes walk to the Pantheon. At night there were some noisy revelers in the area on the weekend (I believe it was what is called a "Pubcrawl"--I'm embarrassed to say but they appeared to be inebriated American college students) , but if the windows are closed one can barely hear the noise and it didn't last long. My husband and I and our 3 children stayed in a suite--1 king-sized bed and 3 singles. The front desk was very helpful with maps, restaurant recommendations and travel services to the airport and the cruise harbor. Very helpful when we arrived early from our flight from the US. I was so happy with my choice to stay at the Hotel Madrid. Don't be put off by the tiny elevator and compact rooms, this is standard in Roman hotels where real estate is at a premium--you'll be so glad of your great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: CraigWilliams
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights at the Hotel Madrid, picked this hotel on the basis of so many good reviews on here. We were not disappointed. Although expensive a lot of what you pay for is the fantastic location. Easily walkable to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Pantheon with Spagna metro station very close as well. Room itself was spacious, bathroom a good size with nice bath and shower. Breakfast included hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs and lovely super crispy bacon. Everything else was typical of a continental breakfast (cereal, many different pastries, yogurt and fruit) and all very nice. The staff at the hotel I couldn’t fault at all, all very friendly and the reception staff were very helpful as well. We booked with Venere but the best bet would be to book direct with the hotel as they offer a 10% discount if you pay with cash. This would have saved us 100 euros.

Reviews.Title: “great location; fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesBonnie
Reviews.Content: Our group of 16 members, ranging in age from 10 to 67, stayed at the Hotel Madrid for 3 nights prior to embarking on a 12-night Western Mediterranean cruise. Our accommodations consisted of 3 suites and 2 double rooms. Hotel Madrid far exceeded our expectations and the staff, in addition to being highly efficient, was courteous, personable and extremely helpful. We enjoyed starting each day with breakfast from the ample and delicious buffet served on the sunny rooftop terrace. We were pleased to discover that Hotel Madrid is not only centrally accessible and within walking distance to all historic sites and great shopping districts of Rome, but is located in an area that is safe both during the day as well as at night. We highly recommend Hotel Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stroppymare
Reviews.Content: Have just returned following a 2 night stay in Hotel Madrid in a triple room which had a double and a single bed. Ok for us as we were all family and female, but could have been a bit difficult if you didnt want to share a bed!! The hotel is in a quiet side street, right next to The Homs, so within easy walking distance of most of the major sights although a good walk to the Colosseum and St Peters. The reception area is small but adequate with some optics behind so this also serves as the bar. There is a small seating area and some barstools. The room (201) and ensuite were adequate - no worse or better than expected. The room had a small balcony with a view of a wall but was quiet at night apart from being woken both nights in the early hours by a bird sqwarking which we assume lived in the adjoining building and which kept us awake for over an hour. A reasonable breakfast was served on the roof terrace but you could see the dome of St Peters over the rooves of the buildings. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. Hotel booked through Venere Transfers by Rome shuttle which I recomment at E35 each way for 3 people. Tour of Vatican/St Peters with My Vatican Tours absolutely superb and worth every penny.
