What our tour guide didnt know wasnt worth knowing. Open top bus around Rome E19 for 24hrs........used when our feet were so sore we couldnt walk any more and as a 'taxi' from place to place. Time Travel Rome -E12, ok but probably could learn as much from a good guide book. Having visited Rome this time last year I was surprised at how much everthing has increased in price . A sprite near the Spanish Steps is E6

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie_Herts
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-day break in Rome, staying at the Hotel Madrid. We had one of the family suites, double bed in one room, twin beds in the other room for our 2 boys (14 and 10). The rooms were not huge, but perectly adequate. The bathroom was a good size with a lovely shower and plenty of big fluffy towels & shower gel/soap. We were grateful for the air conditioning as it was very hot during our stay. This also blocked out the street noise in the evening, along with closing the shutters & windows. The hotel was in a great location, down a narrow side street & just a short stroll to the Spanish Steps & Metro, & also not far from the Trevis Fountain. Just 2 stops on the Metro to Ottiviana for St Peters, and the other way, via Termini Station, to the Colesseum. We flew into Fumicini airport & took the train to Termini station where we picked up the Metro to Spagna. The hotel is just a few minutes walk. There are 2 trains an hour from the airport, and the journey takes about 30mins. The cost is 11 euros each way (our 10 year old was free). Make sure you validate the ticket at the machines on the platform or you may be fined. The Metro tickets are 1 euro and valid for 75 mins. The reception staff at the hotel were all very friendly. We were able to check-in at around 1pm, and when leaving were able to leave our bags for collection later in the afternoon. Breakfast was fine, with a buffet of pastries, fruit, yoghurt, cold meat & cheese, cereals fruit juice & tea/coffee, served from 7 -10am. Plenty of restaurants close by for lunch or evening meals. Would highly recommend this hotel. One tip if visiting the Colesseum, get there early (before 10am) & buy your tickets from the Palantine about 5mins walk away. The ticket gives you access to both the Colesseum & Palatine, but much shorter queue at the latter. The ticket is valid for 2 days. Also, children get in free if EU citizens so take their passports.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: surreyscot
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day stay at the Hotel Madrid in Rome. We had a triple room which was very clean and spacious with a large ensuite shower room. Location excellent 2 mins from Spanish Steps 5 mins from Trevi Fountain. We enjoyed a lovely breakfast every morning on the roof terrace. The staff we very helpful and friendly organising cabs and helping with directions etc. If we every go back to Rome we would certainly stay at this hotel again. Marks out of 10?....10!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: zoobootwo
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be one of the best experiences in the world. We stayed there for 3 nights, and couldn't get over how nice the service was. We'd definitely do it all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite An Experiance”
Reviews.Author: semperfihny
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome. It is centrally located in the heart of the city. You can easily walk to any big attraction from here. The hotel staff was wonderful, very friendly, spoke perfect english and definitly helped out when I couldn't find a place on the map (given to me by the staff). The rooms are kept very clean, and are spacious. The buffett breakfast is one of the best I've had. If you happen to be traveling to Rome I highly recommend the Hotel Madrid it is quite an experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katrina F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Madrid for 3 nights with our two daughters (age 11 and 20) during spring break in March. We choose the hotel based on the trip advisor ratings, especially the ones that discussed the family suites. It was ideal for us. We had booked the suite that slept 5 (even though there were only 4 - we thought it might give us a bit more space). The rooms were generous for Europe standards and there were two rooms with a door in between and one large bathroom with a nice big tub to soak in after a long day of walking around Rome. The bathroom was fairly new with plenty of nice big fluffy towels (I had been expecting the typical European flat towels). The rooftop breakfast was more than continental but less than English (there were some eggs and they would make you toast at the coffee counter as well but it was mainly fruit, fabulous warm pastries, yogurt, cereal, breads, meats and cheese). For us it was just right and it was so nice to sit there each morning and discuss your plans over our pastries and cappuccino while looking out over the rooftops of Rome. The location is really what made this hotel the perfect choice. We were just minutes away from the Spanish Steps and all the shopping. The Trevi Fountain was a stroll in the other direction. We walked over every evening just to wind down our day. The Metro stop is nearby to the left of the Spanish Steps, but honestly we walked almost everywhere. The walk to the Pantheon and the Collosium were easy as well. The only point of warning for very light sleepers, even though the windows are double paned you could hear the street noise at times. We came in on Saturday and it was very loud that evening (plus we were very tired) but that was the only night, Sunday and Monday we didn't hear a thing. It's not the hotel's fault, the windows are double paned and there are shutters you can close, but when you are right in the middle of everything you can't expect silence, there is a lot of foot traffic in this area. (My husband just brings along those disposable ear plugs.) The staff was very helpful with directions, recommendations and even making sure we had a bigger taxi to take us to the train station so that all four would fit with our bags. Overall I was very pleased with the hotel and would recommend it to my friends and family and I would stay there again without hesitation. Also, nice to know, if you pay your bill at the end in cash they will give your a 10% discount off the price booked on the internet. (They emailed me the offer when I booked.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Madrid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane705
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. Good sized rooms. We has a family room and the children has a separate bedroom. Breakfast was good too. Location perfect for getting around, near shops restaurants. Staff very helpful and polite. Made our stay very enjoyable. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: thefreddys
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. Just a few blocks away from the Spanish Steps and the Spagna Metro station. Rooms were quite accomodating. The only downside is that it can be noisy and not just a little noisy but really noisy. Keep the windows closed and you'll survive.

Reviews.Title: “Should be 4 stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: DebizPa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Madrid is a wonderful clean hotel in the center of Rome. The staff is exceptional, especially Antonio. The maid cleaned our room so well each morning, and the rooftop buffet breakfast was hearty enough to skip lunch. We were able to walk just about everywhere, and close enough to the metro and termini station. The staff was at the desk 24 hours a day, they made reservations for us, called taxis, provided maps, helped us with our Italian, and joked with my husband as he buthcered the language. I will definitely stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good for a family.”
Reviews.Author: Pdelis50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family between XMAS and New Years in 2007. Overall a wonderful stay, I will list several pros and cons Pros 1) Location, location, location, walking distance to the spanish steps. shopping, trevi fountain, and a block from a taxi stand and metro which made it really easy to go anywhere in Rome Also on a side street. 2) Staff, All were accomodating, made dining reservations for 3 of the nights that we stayed, helped with whatever we needed, Friendly and spoke English (as well as Spanish and of course Italian well) 3) Breakfast, - Wonderful rooftop view of the city and the food was fine. 4) Room, Room was fine. plenty of space for a Family of 4. Bathroom size was OK, beds and room were clean. Cons (and these are small minor points) 1) there is a nightclub on the street,, One night they were loud, however this can be drowned out by putting on the air conditioner and closing the shutter. as opposed to having the window open the window, we did this for New years eve and slept very well 2) we were on the fourth floor, the elevator is small, so,if you do not like that, then there is a lot of walking up stairs Overall a comfortable stay..
